div.p: Greetings. By the grace of God, I am now feeling a little better, most esteemed Mr. Bullinger.
I am sending you Fabricius's letters.
The envoy from Chur also wrote to me.
He says he has nothing new, but is waiting for me to write something.
Therefore, I wish, Mr. Bullinger, if you have anything by tomorrow, when you have time, to share it with me.
Farewell and forgive the half-blind and now also lame writer. Yours, Konrad Ge√üner.
